name: Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysfunction with Subtalar Joint Instability
chief_complaint: I can't walk properly anymore - my inner ankle collapses inward and hurts terribly
physical_findings: Palpable tenderness posterior to medial malleolus

lab_results.MRI: Complete longitudinal tear of posterior tibial tendon with spring ligament attenuation

treatment: Stage-appropriate surgical reconstruction (FDL transfer, calcaneal osteotomy)
prognosis: Guarded without surgical intervention; progressive deformity leads to rigid flatfoot. Early reconstruction yields 70-80% functional recovery.
description: Advanced stage 3 PTTD involving complete tendon failure with secondary subtalar joint instability and peritalar subluxation. The dysfunctional posterior tibial tendon fails to support the medial arch, leading to progressive collapse of the midfoot and forefoot abduction. Often misdiagnosed as simple tendonitis in early stages.
